Mapbox¶

The Mapbox Geocoding API lets you convert location text into geographic coordinates (1600 Pennsylvania Ave NW → -77.0366,38.8971).

Examples¶

Basic Geocoding¶

>>> import geocoder
>>> g = geocoder.mapbox('San Francisco, CA')
>>> g.json
...

Reverse Geocoding¶

>>> import geocoder
>>> g = geocoder.mapbox([45.15, -75.14], method='reverse')
>>> g.json
...

Command Line Interface¶

$ geocode 'San Francisco, CA' --provider mapbox --out geojson
$ geocode '45.15, -75.14' --provider mapbox --method reverse

Parameters¶

  • location: Your search location you want geocoded.

  • proximity: Search nearby [lat, lng].

  • method: (default=geocode) Use the following:
    • geocode
    • reverse
    • batch

References¶

  • GitHub Repo
  • Mabpox Geocoding API
  • Get Mabpox Access Token

Geocoder is a simple and consistent geocoding library written in Python. Dealing with multiple different geocoding provider such as Google, Bing, OSM & many more has never been easier.

Support

If you are having issues we would love to hear from you. Just hit me up. You can alternatively raise an issue here on Github.
